description: This file defines a Python class 'PostgresTools' that provides methods for connecting to a PostgreSQL database and performing various read-only operations such as listing tables, describing tables, summarizing tables, inspecting queries, exporting tables to CSV, and executing arbitrary SQL queries. It also manages database connection setup and logging.

classes.name: PostgresTools
classes.description: A class that provides tools for interacting with a PostgreSQL database, including listing tables, describing tables, summarizing data, inspecting queries, exporting tables, and executing queries.

methods.name: show_tables
methods.description: Returns a list of table names in the database schema.

methods.name: describe_table
methods.description: Provides a description of a specified table, including column names, data types, and character maximum lengths.

methods.name: summarize_table
methods.description: Computes aggregate statistics over a table, including min, max, average, standard deviation, and counts for numeric and non-numeric columns.

methods.name: inspect_query
methods.description: Returns the execution plan for a given SQL query.

methods.name: export_table_to_path
methods.description: Exports a specified table to a CSV file at a given path.

methods.name: run_query
methods.description: Executes an arbitrary SQL query and returns the result as a string.
